Deprecated API

Contents

  • Deprecated Fields
  • Deprecated Methods
  • Deprecated Fields 
    Field and Description
    com.codeborne.selenide.Condition.appears
    use Condition.visible or Condition.appear
    com.codeborne.selenide.Condition.disappears
    use Condition.disappear or Condition.hidden
  • Deprecated Methods 
    Method and Description
    com.codeborne.selenide.Selenide.$(WebElement, By)
    please use $(parent).$(By) which is the same (method will not be removed until 4.x or later)
    com.codeborne.selenide.Selenide.$(WebElement, By, int)
    please use $(parent).$(By, int) which is the same (method will not be removed until 4.x or later)
    com.codeborne.selenide.Selenide.$(WebElement, String)
    please use $(parent).$(String) which is the same (method will not be removed until 4.x or later)
    com.codeborne.selenide.Selenide.$(WebElement, String, int)
    please use $(parent).$(String, int) which is the same (method will not be removed until 4.x or later)
    com.codeborne.selenide.Selenide.$$(WebElement, By)
    please use $(parent).$$(By) which is the same (method will not be removed until 4.x or later)
    com.codeborne.selenide.Selenide.$$(WebElement, String)
    please use $(parent).$$(String) which is the same (method will not be removed until 4.x or later)
    com.codeborne.selenide.SelenideElement.click(int, int)
    use SelenideElement.click(ClickOptions) with offsets
    com.codeborne.selenide.Selenide.close()
    Use either Selenide.closeWindow() or Selenide.closeWebDriver()
    com.codeborne.selenide.impl.ScreenShotLaboratory.formatScreenShotPath(Driver)
    Use method ScreenShotLaboratory.takeScreenshot(Driver) which returns Screenshot instead of String
    com.codeborne.selenide.Selenide.getElement(By)
    please use element(criteria) which is the same (method will not be removed until 4.x or later) Locates the first element matching given criteria ATTENTION! This method doesn't start any search yet!
    com.codeborne.selenide.Selenide.getElement(By, int)
    please use element(criteria, index) which is the same (method will not be removed until 4.x or later) Locates the Nth element matching given criteria ATTENTION! This method doesn't start any search yet!
    com.codeborne.selenide.Selenide.getElements(By)
    please use elements(criteria) which is the same (method will not be removed until 4.x or later) Locates all elements matching given CSS selector ATTENTION! This method doesn't start any search yet!
    com.codeborne.selenide.ElementsContainer.getSelf()
    I rather think that this method is not needed. You are expected to find elements INSIDE this container, not the container itself.
    com.codeborne.selenide.Condition.matchesText(String)
    use Condition.matchText(String)
    com.codeborne.selenide.ElementsCollection.shouldBe(CollectionCondition, long)
    use ElementsCollection.shouldBe(CollectionCondition, Duration)
    com.codeborne.selenide.ElementsCollection.shouldHave(CollectionCondition, long)
    use ElementsCollection.shouldHave(CollectionCondition, Duration)
    com.codeborne.selenide.impl.ScreenShotLaboratory.takeScreenShot(Driver)
    use ScreenShotLaboratory.takeScreenshot(Driver) which returns Screenshot instead of String
    com.codeborne.selenide.impl.ScreenShotLaboratory.takeScreenShot(Driver, String)
    use ScreenShotLaboratory.takeScreenshot(Driver, String) which returns Screenshot instead of String
    com.codeborne.selenide.Screenshots.takeScreenShot(String)
    Use either Selenide.screenshot(java.lang.String) or SelenideDriver.screenshot(java.lang.String)
    com.codeborne.selenide.SelenideElement.waitUntil(Condition, long)
    use SelenideElement.shouldBe(Condition, Duration) or SelenideElement.shouldHave(Condition, Duration)
    com.codeborne.selenide.SelenideElement.waitUntil(Condition, long, long)
    use SelenideElement.shouldBe(Condition, Duration) or SelenideElement.shouldHave(Condition, Duration)
    com.codeborne.selenide.SelenideElement.waitWhile(Condition, long)
    use SelenideElement.shouldNotBe(Condition, Duration) or SelenideElement.shouldNotHave(Condition, Duration)
    com.codeborne.selenide.SelenideElement.waitWhile(Condition, long, long)
    use SelenideElement.shouldNotBe(Condition, Duration) or SelenideElement.shouldNotHave(Condition, Duration)
